summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to an unspecified recipient, forwarding a chain of emails from May 2021. It contains detailed allegations of ongoing securities fraud, money laundering, and criminal obstruction by the SEC and other entities, focusing on shell companies like Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix/Aspenbio), connections to figures like Barry Honig and John Stetson, and ties to Russian and Pakistani entities. The author appeals to judges and law enforcement for intervention.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email chain, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption and securities fraud related to multiple shell companies and individuals. Presents himself as the whistleblower who filed TCRs.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager, NITE Board Member
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with FSD Pharma and a binding LOI with Israeli Therapix, which is alleged to be part of money laundering schemes.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Repeatedly described as a 'prolific bag man' involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells including Millenium/Inergetics, MGT Capital, Bioptix/RIOT, and others. Central figure in the fraud allegations.

persons.name: John Stetson
persons.context: Frequently mentioned alongside Barry Honig as an investor in alleged money laundering shells like Therapix/SciSparc and Bioptix/RIOT.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Named as a respondent in FINRA/SEC actions related to Aegis Capital. His pension plan is noted as a seller in an offering.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named alongside Robert Eide in SEC proceedings for aiding and abetting Aegis's violations.

persons.name: Michael Gottschall
persons.context: SEC official criticized for a 'thorough investigation' into Riot Blockchain that allegedly never visited the company's HQ and resulted in a termination letter, facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Healthcare fraud felon who entered into a $20M purchase agreement with Millennium Biotech and became a large shareholder. Connected to Honig.

persons.name: Josh Sason
persons.context: Described as a 'prolific bag man' involved with Hanover/Magna and a large holder in Inergetics. Connected to multiple frauds on SDNY courts.

persons.name: John Fife
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved in MGT Capital in 2019 before SEC revoked its registration.

persons.name: Mark B Fisher
persons.role: President of MBF Clearing Corp and MBF Capital
persons.context: His entities were involved in a fraud 'acquisition' of a trading platform by Riot Blockchain. Question is raised about a 'Miami' connection.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Described as a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' on par with Gottschall, potentially connected to the Miami aspect of Fisher's entities.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.role: CEO of Rusnano USA Inc., Head of Russian Federal Energy Agency
persons.context: Named as an insider in Bioptix/Alphasniffer (predecessor to RIOT). Connected to Russian state entity Rusnano, raising national security concerns.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.role: Former DOJ Prosecutor, now Federal Judge
persons.context: Was the 'prosecutor' on the Brian Colleran healthcare fraud civil case. Appointed as a federal judge by Trump.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: His sentencing by Judge Cote is called a 'gross miscarriage of justice,' allegedly set up by Handler/Ressler because he interfered with their Neiman Marcus deal.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Addressed in the email as being in possession of information about SEC corruption. Previously mentioned in context of Hapoalim investigation obstruction.

persons.name: Scott Shay
persons.context: Noted as Chairman of Signature Bank, which was the escrow agent for Bioptix offering and had Ivanka Trump on its board. Also on board of CardWorks.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.role: CFO of multiple OTC shell companies
persons.context: San Diego resident and CFO of several OTC pink sheet companies like Viper Networks, alleged to be part of money laundering schemes known to SEC LA.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group (fka Air-Q), another entity mentioned in the list of alleged shell companies.

connections.description: Frequently mentioned together as investors in multiple alleged money laundering shells like Therapix/SciSparc, Bioptix/RIOT, and others.
Honig controlled Millennium Biotech/Inergetics, in which healthcare fraud felon Colleran was a large shareholder after a $20M purchase agreement.
Both described as 'prolific bag men.' Sason's entities were large holders in Inergetics, a shell controlled by Honig.
Both named in SEC/FINRA actions against Aegis Capital Corp for violations, with McKenna aiding and abetting Eide's firm.
Connected through FSD Pharma and its binding LOI with Therapix, an alleged Honig/Stetson money laundering shell.
Both described as grossly corrupt SEC officials who facilitated or obstructed investigations into alleged frauds.
Fisher's entities have a questioned 'Miami' connection, and Bustilloe is the Miami SEC Director, implying a potential corrupt relationship.
Akhanov was an insider in Bioptix/Alphasniffer, a shell that Honig/Stetson later invested in and pivoted to become RIOT.

events.title: FINRA Settlement with Aegis Capital
events.description: FINRA Office of Hearing Officers accepted an Offer of Settlement from Aegis Capital Corp. (and individuals like Kevin McKenna and Robert Eide) for disciplinary proceedings.

events.title: SEC Ends Investigation into Riot Blockchain
events.description: SEC Denver office, via Michael Gottschall, sent a letter to Riot Blockchain terminating its investigation and recommending no enforcement action, which the author claims was fraudulent.

events.title: SEC Declines to Review RIOT Offering
events.description: Following the terminated investigation, the SEC Division of Corporation Finance chose not to review a Riot Blockchain S-3 offering in December 2020.

events.title: Dilorio's Email Appeals to Judges
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends a series of emails in May 2021 to SDNY judges, NY Supreme Court judges, and others, detailing allegations of SEC corruption and pleading for a subpoena.

events.title: Colleran Millennium Biotech Purchase Agreement
events.description: Healthcare fraud felon Brian Colleran entered into a five-year $20 million purchase agreement with Millennium Biotechnologies Inc.

events.title: Marvell Acquires Aquantia
events.description: Chip company Marvell completed its acquisition of Aquantia, a company in which Rusnano (connected to Dmitry Akhanov) had invested.

locations: Castle Rock, Colorado (alleged HQ of Riot Blockchain)
20 Raul Wallenberg Street, Tower A, Tel Aviv 6971916, Israel (SciSparc/Therapix address)
850 Library Ave., Suite 204, Newark, DE 19711 (Puglisi & Associates)
New York, NY (SDNY jurisdiction, Aegis Capital, MBF Clearing)
Miami, FL (connection to Mark Fisher and SEC Director Eric Bustilloe)
San Diego, California (UBS office, Jason Sunstein, International Land Alliance)
Pakistan (connected to Ibex Ltd and The Resource Group)
keyFacts: The author, Christopher Dilorio, alleges massive, ongoing securities fraud and money laundering facilitated by SEC corruption, with shell companies like Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix/Aspenbio) at the center.
Key figures Barry Honig and John Stetson are repeatedly implicated as controlling multiple 'money laundering shells' that pivot between industries (biotech to crypto) to facilitate fraud.
Russian state entity Rusnano and its USA CEO Dmitry Akhanov are connected to Bioptix/RIOT, raising alleged national security implications.
The SEC's termination of the Riot Blockchain investigation in January 2020 is characterized as criminal obstruction, as the investigator allegedly never visited the company's Colorado headquarters.

The email chain appeals directly to multiple federal and state judges (Engelmayer, Ramos, Quraishi, Cote) and law enforcement, pleading for intervention and subpoenas to expose the alleged corruption.
